meanings.definition: A lively, French country dance in which the dancers form two facing lines.
meanings.sent1: During the village celebration, everyone joined in the contredanse, moving in sync.
meanings.sent2: The contredanse at the festival was filled with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent3: The contredanse at the wedding had everyone smiling and clapping along.
meanings.sent4: The contredanse of life's rhythm keeps us all in step with each other.
meanings.sent5: The contredanse was so energetic, it left everyone breathless and happy.

meanings.definition: A piece of music composed for or in the style of a contredanse.
meanings.sent1: The musicians played a lively contredanse that had everyone tapping their feet.
meanings.sent2: The contredanse music set the perfect mood for the outdoor party.
meanings.sent3: The contredanse melody was so catchy, it stayed in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: The contredanse of notes danced through the air, enchanting all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The contredanse music was like a cheerful invitation to dance and have fun.
